events.message: The applicant submitted the personal loan application intending to cover upcoming medical expenses and consolidate existing debt.
The loan application was categorized under personal loans due to the stated purpose of covering medical bills and debt repayment.
An experienced loan officer was assigned to handle the applicant’s personal loan request and guide them through the process.
The loan officer conducted an initial review of the submitted information verifying all required fields were complete and accurate.
Additional documents, including recent pay stubs, bank statements, and medical bills, were requested from the applicant for further assessment.
Applicant promptly submitted all requested documentation demonstrating income verification and medical expense details.
The credit bureau report was reviewed, indicating a moderately good credit score with some past credit card debt currently being paid off.
Risk team evaluated the credit and financial documents and determined the risk level of the personal loan application as acceptable.
The loan officer presented an offer of $15,000 personal loan with an interest rate of 8%, tailored to accommodate medical bill payments and debt consolidation.
Applicant responded positively to the terms, expressing satisfaction with the offer and readiness to proceed with approval steps.
Application was escalated to senior loan management for final approval due to loan amount and applicant’s recent credit history nuances.
Senior management approved the personal loan application after thorough review, confirming loan terms and conditions.
Funds of $15,000 were disbursed to the applicant’s designated bank account for use on medical treatment and debt obligations.
Follow-up call was made to ensure the applicant received funds and to provide assistance with any additional questions or support needed.
The loan case was formally closed after successful funding and follow-up, with all documentation completed and logged.
